snippet: Recent embarrassments involving rappers and their product endorsements highlight the conflicting values and public images of hip-hop artists and mainstream corporations.
abstract: Jon Caramanica article maintains hip-hop stars are natural fit for corporate endorsements and suggests, instead of dropping rappers when inevitable controversy arises, companies could turn incidents into opportunities for creative corporate citizenship; notes many rappers now eschew endorsements in favor of starting their own businesses.
lead_paragraph: Recent embarrassments involving rappers and their product endorsements highlight the conflicting values and public images of hip-hop artists and mainstream corporations.

headline.seo: Lil Wayne and Other Rappers Run Afoul of Propriety
headline.main: Rap, Both Good and Bad for Business
headline.print_headline: Rap, Both Good and Bad for Business

keywords.value: Odd Future Wolf Gang Kill Them All
keywords.name: organizations
